awd_titl_txt: Theoretical Studies of Continuous and Discrete-Time ElectricCircuits
awd_abstract_narration: The general goal of this research project is the development of a               better understanding of the fundamental nature of discrete time                 circuits, fault diagnosis in analog circuits and nonlinear transistor           networks and their properties, and the development of new mathematical          techniques for their analysis and design.  Utilization of results from          the proposed work is expected in important applications such as the             checkout and maintenance of complex electronic circuit boards and in            the development of analytical methods for solving related problems.             The research will also contribute significantly to the training of new          researches and result in PhD dissertations.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
